text: "This must be Thursday," said Arthur to himself, sinking low over his beer, "I never could get the hang of Thursdays."
Time is an illusion. Lunchtime doubly so.
"You'd better be prepared for the jump into hyperspace. It's unpleasantly like being drunk.""What's so unpleasant about being drunk?""You ask a glass of water."
If there's anything more important than my ego around, I want it caught and shot now.

There are of course many problems connected with life, of which some of the most popular are "Why are people born?" "Why do they die?" "Why do they spend so much of the intervening time wearing digital watches?"
In the beginning the Universe was created. This has made a lot of people very angry and been widely regarded as a bad move.
Anyone who is capable of getting themselves made President should on no account be allowed to do the job.

"A curse," said Slartibartfast, "which will engulf the Galaxy in fire and destruction, and possibly bring the Universe to a premature doom. I mean it," he added."Sounds like a bad time," said Ford, "with luck I'll be drunk enough not to notice."

The major difference between a thing that might go wrong and a thing that cannot possibly go wrong is that when a thing that cannot possibly go wrong goes wrong it usually turns out to be impossible to get at or repair.
If it looks like a duck, and quacks like a duck, we have at least to consider the possibility that we have a small aquatic bird of the family anatidae on our hands.
Time does not count itself. You have only to look at a circle and this is apparent.
Ultimately, all things are known because you want to believe you know.
Answers are a perilous grip on the universe. They can appear sensible yet explain nothing.
Paired opposites define your longings and those longings imprison you.
Truth suffers from too much analysis.

He who would do good to another must do it in  Minute Particulars:General Good is the plea of the scoundrel,  hypocrite, and flatterer,For Art and Science cannot exist but in minutely  organized Particulars.
Eternity is in love with the productions of time.

Experience is not a matter of having actually swum the Hellespont, or danced with the dervishes, or slept in a doss-house. It is a matter of sensibility and intuition, of seeing and hearing the significant things, of paying attention at the right moments, of understanding and coordinating. Experience is not what happens to a man; it is what a man does with what happens to him.
This is it, you've only got one shot, and it's already started

The geometry of landscape and situation seems to create its own systems of time, the sense of a dynamic element which is cinematising the events of the canvas, translating a posture or ceremony into dynamic terms. The greatest movie of the 20th century is the Mona Lisa, just as the greatest novel is Gray's Anatomy.
time is the moving image of eternity...
We hypostatize information into objects. Rearrangement of objects is change in the content of information. This is the language we have lost the ability to read.
Pay attention. And keep breathing.
The future has arrived; it's just not evenly distributed.

Music is prophecy: its styles and economic organisation are ahead of the rest of society because it explores, much faster than material reality can, the entire range of possibilities in a given code. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become visible.

The music of a civilization has far-reaching consequences on consciousness and, thus, influences the basic nature of a society. Music and its rhythms divert and compel the awareness, describing the limits within which a consciousness, thus fascinated, may operate. Control the music, then, and you own a powerful tool with which to shape the society.
Some people never go crazy, what truly horrible lives they must lead.
oh - my hair's getting good in the back
We must be willing to get rid of the life we've planned, so as to have the life that is waiting for us.
In theory, there is no difference between theory and practice.  But, in practice, there is.
Not all those who wander are lost.
Too much of a good thing can be wonderful
The brain is a wonderful organ; it starts working the moment you get up in the morning, and does not stop until you get to school.
Computers in the future may weigh no more than 1.5 tons.
source: Popular Mechanics, forecasting the relentless march of science, 1949

text: This 'telephone' has too many shortcomings to be seriously considered as a  means of communication. The device is inherently of no value to us.
640K ought to be enough for anybody.
There is *always* one more bug.
Would it help if I got out and pushed?
Sometimes one pays most for the things one gets for nothing. If I had my life to live over again, I'd be a plumber.
If I only had a brain...
He who is lost in his passion is less lost than he who has lost his passion
It's not my fault!
I'm standing here in pieces, and you're having delusions of grandeur!
It's not my fault!
Nnnooooooooooooooooooooooooooo!
The difference between stupidity and genius is that genius has its limits.
When I first heard Elvis' voice, I just knew that I wasn't going to work for anybody and nobody was gonna be my boss. Hearing him for the first time was like busting out of jail.
May you live every day of your life.
Never ascribe to malice that which can be adequately explained by ignorance.
It is better to know some of the questions than all of the answers.
Puritanism: the haunting fear that someone, somewhere may be happy.
Hard work spotlights the character of people: some turn up their sleeves, some turn up their noses, and some don't turn up at all.
It is always advisable to be a loser if you cannot become a winner.
God is a great humorist. It's just that he has a slow audience to work with.
A person who has never made a mistake never tried anything new.
Stupidity has a certain charm - ignorance does not.
There is more stupidity than hydrogen in the universe, and it has a longer shelf life.
All the good music has already been written by people with wigs and stuff.
Art is making something out of nothing and selling it.
The computer can't tell you the emotional story. It can give you the exact mathematical design, but what's missing is the eyebrows.
You cannot be a real country unless you have a beer and an airline. It helps if you have some kind of a football team, or some nuclear weapons, but at the very least you need a beer.
Quote? What do you want a lousy quote for?
source: Eric C. Thomsonc/o The Darque Side Ascii Express Line

text: I think the western world is a bit too selfish and that there is a lot of resentment... You know, the poor get relatively poorer all the time and the rich are getting richer all the time.
You can fool too many of the people too much of the time.
People only see what they are prepared to see.
Computers are useless. They can only give you answers.
Get your facts first, and then you can distort them as much as you please.
They that can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary safety deserve neither liberty nor safety.
Imagination is more important than knowledge.  Knowledge is limited.  Imagination encircles the world.
The scientific theory I like best is that the rings of Saturn are composed entirely of lost airline luggage.
Artificial Intelligence is no match for natural stupidity.
The Constitution only gives people the right to pursue happiness.  You have to catch it yourself.
Every gun that is made, every warship launched, every rocket fired, signifies in the final sense a theft from those who hunger and are not fed, those who are cold and are not clothed.
I hope God's much more forgiving than I am.
God is too big to fit into just ONE religion.
Both kings and philosophers shit.  And so do ladies.
I thought marriage was for having someone to pick you up at the airport.
I'll let you be in my dream if I can be in yours.
He who fights too long against dragons becomes a dragon himself; and if you gaze too long into the abyss, the abyss will gaze into you.
In a time of universal deceit, telling the truth is a revolutionary act.
He who controls the past commands the future. He who commands the future conquers the past.
On the whole, human beings want to be good, but not too good, and not quite all the time.
The nationalist not only does not disapprove of atrocities committed by his own side, but he has a remarkable capacity for not even hearing about them.
Laugh while you can, Monkey Boy!
The only reason for time is so that everything doesn't happen at once.
There is no greater evil than arrogance backed by brute force.
What difference does it make to the dead, the orphans, and the homeless, whether the mad destruction is brought under the name of totalitarianism or the holy name of liberty and democracy?
It is a very sad thing that nowadays there is so little useless information.
Never eat more than you can lift.
We are here on earth to do good to others.  What the others are here for, I don't know.
We used to think that if we knew one, we knew two, because one and one are two. We are finding that we must learn a great deal more about "and".

I bent my wookie!

What this country really needs is a good defoliant.

Which one is one?
Maybe this world is another planet's Hell.
SERENITY NOW!!

I am at two with nature.

The lion and the lamb will lie down together, but the lamb won't get much sleep.
We hang the petty thieves and appoint the great ones to public office.

Reason has always existed, but not always in a reasonable form.
O Lord, help me to be pure, but not yet.
You're not to be so blind with patriotism that you can't face reality. Wrong is wrong, no matter who does it or says it.
I am a deeply superficial person.
Don't let it end like this. Tell them I said something.
Doubt is not a pleasant condition, but certainty is an absurd one.
If God did not exist, it would be necessary to invent him.
Those who can make you believe absurdities can make you commit atrocities.
Heh heh, dying tickles!

source: former U.S. National Security Adviser Zbigniew Brzezinski

text: I think that gay marriage is something that should be between a man and a woman.

Reports that say something hasn't happened are interesting to me, because as we know, there are known unknowns; there things we know we know.  We also know there are known unknowns; that is to say we know there are some things we do not know. But there are also unknown unknowns - the ones we don't know we don't know.
Extraordinary claims require extraordinary evidence.

text: Political unrest stabilizes society, yeah.

Go fuck yourself.

Gort, Klaatu barada nikto.
Voluntatem tuam vivendi siccabit.
A witty saying proves nothing.
Now, now my good man, this is no time for making enemies.
source: Voltaire on his deathbed in response to a priest asking that he renounce Satan.

text: Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed citizens can change the world.  Indeed, it's the only thing that ever has.

Grandpa: "I'm an old man, no one listens to me."Lisa: "I'm a young girl, no one listens to me."Homer: "I'm a white male aged 18 to 49, everyone listens to me, no matter how dumb my suggestions are."

Life should not be a journey to the grave with the intention of arriving safely in a pretty and well preserved body, but rather to skid in broadside in a cloud of smoke, thoroughly used up, totally worn out, and loudly proclaiming "Wow! What a Ride!".
Hell is empty and all the devils are here.
The good thing about standards is that there are so many to choose from.
A patriot must always be ready to defend his country against his government.

Voice or no voice, the people can always be brought to the bidding of the leaders. That is easy. All you have to do is tell them they are being attacked and denounce the pacifists for lack of patriotism and exposing the country to greater danger. It works the same way in any country.

Everything that can be invented has been invented.
source: Charles H. Duell, Commissioner, U.S. Office of Patents, 1899

text: A man is a success if he gets up in the morning and gets to bed at night, and in between he does what he wants to do.

source: Governor George W. Bush, U.S. Presidential candidate

text: You can no more win a war than you can win an earthquake.

Melancholy is incompatible with bicycling.
